intro: Dactylopetalum ellipticifolium, commonly known as the oval-leaf dactylopetalum, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elliptical-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
